string-array.name: tech_array
string-array.item: Harvard University
Stanford University
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
University of Cambridge
University of Oxford
California Institute of Technology (Caltech)
University of Chicago
Columbia University
Princeton University
Yale University

string-array.name: tech_array_subtitle
string-array.item: Harvard University, established in 1636, is one of the oldest and most prestigious universities in the world, known for its strong programs in law, business, and medicine.
Stanford University, located in California, is renowned for its research in technology and entrepreneurship, often linked to Silicon Valley innovations.
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) is a world leader in science, engineering, and technology education, with a strong focus on research and innovation.
University of Cambridge, founded in 1209, is one of the oldest universities in the world, known for its strong emphasis on research and academic excellence.
University of Oxford is the oldest university in the English-speaking world, with a rich history in humanities, sciences, and a distinctive tutorial system.
California Institute of Technology (Caltech) is a top institution specializing in science and engineering, with a high student-to-faculty ratio for personalized education.
University of Chicago is recognized for its rigorous academic programs, particularly in economics, political science, and social sciences.
Columbia University, located in New York City, is one of the Ivy League schools, famous for its strong programs in journalism, business, and international relations.
Princeton University is known for its focus on undergraduate education and research, with strengths in fields like humanities, social sciences, and engineering.
